STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
February 29, 2024
Linda Needham
LENAWEE COUNTY DHHS
1040 S WINTER ST,
ADRIAN, MI, 49221-3876
Re: License #: CP460201242
SI #: 2024C0001092SI
Dear Linda Needham:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616)204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Holly Austin, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2024C0001092SI
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 26, 2024
License #: CP460201242
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius Starling
Chief Administrator: Linda Needham
Agency Name: LENAWEE COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 1040 S WINTER ST
ADRIAN, MI 49221-3876
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 10/11/2025
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
1/25/2024 12:43 PM Video Conference Special Investigation Initiation
1/25/2024 12:44 PM Video Conference Special Investigation Initiation
1/26/2024 12:39 PM Email Other
1/26/2024 2:58 PM Email Other
2/1/2024 11:44 AM Email Other
III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff responsibilities
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12207
Section (3) An agency shall require that social service workers be directly
Description responsible for all the following activities:
1

(b) Facilitating services and parenting time for children for
purposes of reunification.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The case manager did not provide case management as required.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Complainant – This investigation was initiated internally after
concerns arose during an investigation of Community Care
Organization. That investigation resulted due to allegations
submitted by Foster Care Supervisor 1, a supervisor at Lenawee
County DHHS. That investigation is documented in special
investigation report #2024C0001069SI. During that investigation, it
was determined most of the items alleged to have not been
completed by Community Care Organization were the
responsibility of Lenawee County DHHS staff.
Foster Care Supervisor 1 –Foster Care Supervisor 1 was
interviewed via Microsoft Teams on 1/25/2024. She indicated she
has been assigned at Lenawee County DHHS for Youth A’s case
since he came into care. Foster Care Supervisor 1 reported Youth
A was referred to Community Care Organization’s Independent
Living Plus (ILP) home and program by Lenawee County DHHS
staff upon removal from his parental home. They accepted Youth
A into their program on 6/16/2023. After accepting Youth A’s case,
Community Care Organization’s Program Manager/Foster Care
Supervisor (Foster Care Supervisor 2) told Foster Care Supervisor
1 Community Care Organization does not provide services to birth
parents. Foster Care Supervisor 1 reported she reviewed
Community Care Organization’s contract and realized they do not
provide services to birth parents at which time Lenawee County
DHHS took over case management of Youth A. Foster Care
Supervisor 1 stated she was assigned as primary supervisor and
a DHHS foster care worker was assigned as the primary worker
on the case as of 7/24/2023. During this interview, Foster Care
Supervisor 1 expressed her misunderstanding of the Independent
Living Plus contract and responsibilities. She came to the
realization that Community Care Organization staff were not
responsible for the allegations she included in her complaint
against them as they were no longer responsible for case
management of Youth A once she told them her staff would be
taking over case management responsibility. She reported her
staff relied on Community Care Organization to enroll the youth in
school, ensure his medical care follow-up services, authorize
2

mental health follow-up services, and complete social work
contacts, none of which were completed timely. She stated the
allegations she submitted against Community Care Organization
were not valid as those allegations would have been the
responsibility of her staff.
Foster Care Worker 1 – Foster Care Worker 1 was interviewed
via Microsoft Teams on 1/25/2024. She reported she was not the
initial DHHS foster care worker assigned but was assigned to
Youth A’s case as primary foster care worker in August of 2023.
She reported she believed Community Care Organization staff
were responsible for case management of Youth A until the time
he left the program on 10/20/2023. She expressed concerns that
Community Care Organization did not obtain a state ID for Youth
A, did not complete timely social work contacts, did not arrange
and facilitate all sibling visits, did not enroll him in school timely,
and did not ensure he received mental health and medical care
follow-up services following an emergency room visit, all of which
was the responsibility of the primary foster care worker.
Foster Care Supervisor 2 – Foster Care Supervisor 2, who is
also the Program Manager for Community Care Organization, was
interviewed via Microsoft Teams on 1/26/2024. She reported she
accepted Youth A into Community Care Organization under the
terms of their contract. She stated her understanding at the time
the case was accepted was that Lenawee County DHHS would
have family responsibility of the case to work with Youth A’s
sibling and parents and Community Care Organization would have
case management of Youth A only, which is what has historically
happened whenever they accept a case involving parents and
siblings. Foster Care Supervisor 2 stated she was initially
assigned as the supervisor for the whole case and had multiple
conversations and email exchanges with Foster Care Supervisor 1
to explain that she had only accepted case management
responsibilities on Youth A and that her agency could not provide
case management to the younger sibling and parents as their
contract does not allow them to do so. Foster Care Supervisor 2
stated it did not seem as if Foster Care Supervisor 1 understood
what Foster Care Supervisor 2 was attempting to explain and on
7/24/2023 Lenawee County DHHS staff assigned themselves as
primary workers and supervisor on Youth A’s case. She stated
she asked Foster Care Supervisor 1 to add Foster Care
Supervisor 2 back as primary supervisor on Youth A’s case
multiple times, but this never occurred. She indicated her agency
continued to provide case management services as best they
3

could, but they had limitations due to not being assigned case
management authority.
DOCUMENT REVIEW
Placement history in Youth A’s electronic case record:
• 6/16/2023 – 10/20/2023 Community Care Organization
Case assignments in Youth A’s electronic case record:
• Primary Supervisor
-6/16/2023 – 7/24/2023, Supervisor 2 (Community Care
Organization)
-7/24/2023 – 10/20/2023, Foster Care Supervisor 1 (Lenawee
DHHS)
• Secondary Supervisor
-6/16/2023 – 7/24/2023, Foster Care Supervisor 1 (Lenawee
DHHS)
-7/24/2023 – 10/20/2023, Supervisor 2 (Community Care
Organization)
• Primary Worker
-6/16/2023 – 7/10/2023, Foster Care Worker 3 (Community Care
Organization)
-7/10/2023-7/24/2023, Foster Care Worker 2 (Community Care
Organization)
-7/24/2023 - 8/16/2023, Foster Care Worker 4 (Lenawee DHHS)
-8/16/2023 – 10/20/2023, Foster Care Worker 1 (Lenawee DHHS)
• Secondary Worker
-6/16/2023 – 7/24/2023, Foster Care Worker 4 (Lenawee DHHS)
-6/21/2023 – 10/20/2023, Foster Care Worker 2 (Community Care
Organization)
Case Referral and Acceptance form (DHS-3600) for Youth A,
effective 6/16/2023, signed by Program Manager 1 on 6/21/2023
and Community Care Organization’s Director on 6/22/2023
indicating the contract is for ILP services.
Emails between Community Care Organization and Lenawee
DHHS staff provided by Foster Care Supervisor 1:
• 6/15/2023 to DHHS accepting Youth A into Community Care
Organization’s program.
• 6/16/2023 from DHHS asking if Community Care Organization
handles the foster care portion.
• 6/20/2023 from Foster Care Worker 2 with the information
needed by Foster Care Worker 4 to enter in 3600.
4

• 6/21/2023 from Foster Care Worker 4 to Foster Care Supervisor
2 indicating the 3600 is attached and asking if Foster Care Worker
2 should be assigned in MiSACWIS.
• 7/14/2023 from Foster Care Worker 4 to Foster Care Worker 2
and Foster Care Supervisor 2 stating she is meeting with the birth
mother and asking if either Foster Care Worker 2 or Supervisor 2
would like to attend that meeting.
• 7/14/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care Worker
4 stating she could meet with the mother during that meeting;
however, she was informed DHHS should have “full family” as
Community Care Organization only accepted responsibility of
Youth A.
• 7/18/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 1 to Foster Care
Supervisor 2 asking what is meant by Foster Care Supervisor 2’s
email stating MDHHS should have full family.
• 7/18/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care
Supervisor 1 stating Community Care Organization only has
responsibility for Youth A per their contract.
• 7/24/2023 Email from Foster Care Supervisor 1 to Foster Care
Supervisor 2 stating she read through the ILP contract and as
soon as the ISP is approved, DHHS would take back case
management of Youth A with an apology for the confusion.
• 7/25/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 1 to Foster Care
Supervisor 2 asking her to unassign herself so Foster Care
Worker 4 could be assigned.
• 8/2/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care
Supervisor 1 asking to be assigned to the case.
• 8/2/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 1 asking Foster Care
Supervisor 2 what she would like to be assigned as in the case
record.
• 8/2/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care
Supervisor 1 stating she is the foster care supervisor.
• 8/3/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care Worker 4
requesting the case be assigned to Community Care Organization
as they could not do any work on the case.
• 8/3/2023 from Foster Care Worker 4 to Foster Care Supervisor 2
stating she would talk with her supervisor.
• 8/3/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 asking what role Foster
Care Supervisor 2 how she would be assigned in the case record
since DHHS took over foster care responsibility.
• 8/4/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care
Supervisor 1 indicating she requested the case be assigned back
as they cannot complete any work.
• 8/4/2023 from Foster Care Supervisor 1 stating she assigned
Foster Care Supervisor 2 as secondary supervisor so she can
5

enter data and asking what data she would need to enter now that
she is not in the foster care role.
• 8/7/2023 Foster Care Supervisor 2 to Foster Care Supervisor 1
with a screenshot example of another case in which a different
agency has full family responsibility while Community Care
Organization has responsibility of one youth with a request to
discuss by phone.
Analysis During interviews with Foster Care Supervisor 1 and Foster Care
Worker 1, they reported they expected Community Care
Organization to provide foster care and independent living case
management of Youth A from 6/16/2023 until 10/20/2023 despite
Lenawee County DHHS taking over case management of Youth A
on 7/24/2023. By their own admission, Lenawee County DHHS
staff did not provide the required case management of Youth A
from 7/24/2023 through 10/20/2023, which would have included
ensuring his school enrollment, medical and mental health care,
sibling visitation, and case contacts; therefore, a violation is
established.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code Development of service plans
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12418
Section (2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
Description and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Service plans were not completed timely.
Investigation INTERVIEWS
Complainant – This investigation was initiated internally after
concerns arose during an investigation of Community Care
Organization. That investigation was the result allegations
submitted by Foster Care Supervisor 1, a supervisor at Lenawee
County DHHS. That investigation is documented in special
investigation report #2024C0001069SI. During that investigation, it
was determined the majority of the items alleged to have not been
completed by Community Care Organization were the
responsibility of Lenawee County DHHS staff.
6

Foster Care Supervisor 1 –Foster Care Supervisor 1 was
interviewed via Microsoft Teams on 1/25/2024. When asked about
her initial allegations that Community Care Organization did not
complete service plans timely, she indicated that the only report
they completed late was the initial service plan. The updated
service plan, which was also completed late, was completed by
Foster Care Worker 1.
Foster Care Worker 1 – Foster Care Worker 1, was interviewed
via Microsoft Teams on 1/25/2024. Foster Care Worker 1 reported
she did not complete Youth A’s updated service plan timely due to
her grandmother’s death.
DOCUMENT REVIEW
Updated Service Plan due 10/12/2023 completed by Foster Care
Worker 1 on 10/30/2023.
Analysis Violation is established due to the updated service plan being
completed 18 days late.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
February 20, 2024
______________________________________
Holly Austin Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 29, 2024
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
